intro: Isoloma ceciliae, commonly known as the Cecilia's lily, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Iridaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant features striking, showy flowers with six petals arranged in a symmetrical pattern, often in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, typically growing in dense clumps. Isoloma ceciliae thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous habitats.
